info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 3:01PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Transylvania, northwestern Greenville and northwestern Pickens Counties through 330 PM EDT... At 300 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles southwest of Brevard, or 4 miles east of Gorges State Park, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rosman, Gorges State Park, Jocassee Gorges, Table Rock State Park, Lake Jocassee, Sunset, Sassafras Mountain and Rocky Bottom. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
